title: Stopping Rules
desc1_desc: The Stopping Rules provide guidance on how to pause or stop during Quranic recitation, ensuring proper pronunciation and adherence to Tajweed principles.
desc2_desc: Various rules for stopping, such as on sounds, Fat-Hah Tanween, Mushaddad letters, and more, are illustrated through examples.

Lessons.name: Stopping on Sounds Other Than Fat-Hah Tanween
Lessons.pengertian: When stopping, treat the final letter as if it carries a Sukoon (silent ending).
Lessons.caraMembaca: Pause softly while neutralizing the final vowel sound.

Lessons.name: Stopping on Fat-Hah Tanween
Lessons.pengertian: If the last letter has Fat-Hah Tanween or is followed by an alif-madd, stop in alignment with the Fat-Hah Tanween rule.
Lessons.caraMembaca: Drop the Tanween sound and stop cleanly.

Lessons.name: Stopping on the Letter ة
Lessons.pengertian: Treat the ة as if it has a Sukoon like the letter ه.
Lessons.caraMembaca: Pronounce softly with no vowel sound.

subrules.title: Qalqalah Letters (ق, ط, ب, ج, د)
subrules.pengertian: Pronounce the letter with a strong Qalqalah (echo effect) in its Saakin form.

subrules.title: Other Letters
subrules.pengertian: Treat the letter as if it has a Sukoon but hold the sound in the nose for 2 beats (Ghunnah).

subrules.title: Non-Qalqalah Mushaddad Letters
subrules.pengertian: Replace the Shaddah with a Sukoon and pause slightly (nabr).

Lessons.name: Stopping on Saakin or Madd Letters (ء, ى, ا)
Lessons.pengertian: Stop as written, without making any changes.

exceptions.title: Ending on ى or ء
exceptions.pengertian: Convert ى or ء to a Sukoon.

exceptions.title: Ending on a Very Long Madd

Quizs.question: Which phrase represents the correct application of Stopping Rules for فِي شَكٍّ?

answers.answer: Treat it as if it has a Dhammah.

Quizs.question: Which writing correctly applies the Stopping Rules for قُلِ ٱللَّهُمَّ?

answers.answer: Add a Tanween to the word.
Treat it as if it has a Kasrah.

Quizs.question: How should the ة be treated when stopping on a word like بَصِيْرَةٌ?

answers.answer: Pronounce it as if it has a Sukoon like the letter ه.

Quizs.question: What happens when stopping on a word ending in a Qalqalah letter like يُولَدُ?

answers.answer: Recite it as if it has a Madd.

Quizs.question: What is the correct stopping method for a word ending in Madd like أَنَا?

answers.answer: Replace the long Madd with Madd Asli.
Add a Tanween to the end.

Quizs.question: What does the Stopping Rule require when ending on Saakin letters (ء, ى, ا)?

answers.answer: Stop as written without making any changes.
Add a Sukoon to the letter.
